radiographic_examinations.findings: Minimal dependent atelectasis. Minimal nonspecific central bronchial wall thickening. Lungs are clear. No pericardial or pleural effusion. Heart size is normal. Great vessels are patent and normal in caliber. No pulmonary embolus detected to the subsegmental levels. No axillary or mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Gallbladder is moderately distended, containing at least two large stones at the neck, with trace pericholecystic fluid against the liver (up to 5 mm). Small hiatal hernia present. 13-mm right adrenal nodule compatible with adenoma. Normal pancreas, spleen, adrenal glands, and intra-abdominal loops of small and large bowel. Normal appendix. No intrapelvic lymphadenopathy or free fluid. Status post left total hip arthroplasty with no evidence of hardware loosening or failure, and no acute fracture.
